content.description: Climb the wide crack in the center of the wall for 20 to a v-notch. Walk out the notch to the trees above.

The crux on this route is the opening move after that it eases off. Start up the head wall to gain the slab above. Follow a flake system to a ledge and then a short runout to the top. This route was named in remembrance of my grandfather who passed away that same day.
content.protection: Gear is questionable at best this ones gets a PG added to it but you should find enough gear to get you to feel good. For the anchor find a tree way back
content.location: This is on the left side of the Upper Slabs

content.description: On the far right side of the Upper Crack Wall look for the obvious offwidth that looks like the Finger of Fate on Cannons Moby Grape. Make the crux moves off the ground to get established in the crack. Continue up the crack to a decent #6 Camelot before the top out. (The climb might protect with big bros). 35
Locate a hand crack in a left facing corner. Climb the hand crack past some hollow sounding rock to an interesting finish. 30
The crux of this climb is the first 20 feet or so. A juggy head wall turns into a nice featured slab.
content.protection: The pro is ok at best, just need to look. When I was cleaning, it looked like there would be no gear but as I climbed I found plenty. Get creative with your anchor at top.
content.location: This is the middle route located on the Upper Slab area.

content.description: Start to the right side of the short face. Climb up the some what blocky cornner then step onto the almost vertical slab (crux) then pop up on the slab and follow the clean streek to the top.
content.protection: Sling a tree to start and then some small pieces and two red tri cams. Get creative with your anchor.
content.location: Rap in and find the right side of the slab.

content.description: The Upper Slabs and Cracks offer some fun climbing at a moderate grade. The climbs can be seen on the upper right hand side of the slabs and left of the Pinnacle Block. A large offwidth crack reminiscent of the Finger of Fate on Cannon can be seen above.
